page.title: 19Housing etc.;the Hurn block.
page.content: 1983 figures obtained from Holbeach library give the population of Holbeach Hurn as 166,with 64 occupied dwellings inside the village boundary.This could probably be doubled if all the isolated houses in this block are included.About 1\ miles from the village is a row of semi-detatched houses built for soldiers returning from the First World War.They are called Crown Colony and had one acre of land each plus a packing shed.Many buildings are old,and have been modernised but retain their character.There are a lot of tied cottages,although some are now being sold.Holbeach Hurn has a short avenue of council houses built in the 1930's.There are 6 purpose built old peoples bungalows sited near the shop and telephone.There are many old, large,family farmhouse from the 1800s.
